docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept, 28 -- Denmark proposed today that the Eastern and Western powers take a new step toward disarmament by opening approximately corresponding sections of their territories to international inspection.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept, 28 -- Denmark proposed today that the Eastern and Western powers take a new step toward disarmament by opening approximately corresponding sections of their territories to international inspection.
docs.abstract: Min Krag (Denmark) urges setting aside areas for inspection, Assembly; offers Greenland as proving ground; Min Segni (Italy) says any new negotiating group should be linked to UN; Deputy Premier Naim (Afghanistan) urges disarmament

headline.main: Denmark Bids 2 Blocs Take New Disarming Step; Partial World Inspection Is Proposed in U.N. Assembly East and West Urged to Open Corresponding Areas

byline.original: By LINDESAY PARROTTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: YESTERDAY (Sept. 28, 1960) GENERAL ASSEMBLY Continued general debate hearing Eduardo V. Haedo, President-elect of the National Council of Government of Uruguay; Jens O. Krag, Foreign Minister of Denmark; Todor Zhivkov, member of Presidium of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: YESTERDAY (Sept. 28, 1960) GENERAL ASSEMBLY Continued general debate hearing Eduardo V. Haedo, President-elect of the National Council of Government of Uruguay; Jens O. Krag, Foreign Minister of Denmark; Todor Zhivkov, member of Presidium of the National Assembly of Bulgaria; Jorge B. Illueca, Panama's delegate; Antonio Segni, Foreign Minister of Italy and Sardar Mohammed Naim, second deputy Premier of Afghanistan.

docs.snippet: LEADING ISSUES KHRUSHCHEV The Reds way of looking at things is to claim everything, concede nothing and if defeated claim fraud. He [Khrushchev] has suffered, one defeat after another the past week and he shows it by knocking on the desk with his...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEADING ISSUES KHRUSHCHEV The Reds way of looking at things is to claim everything, concede nothing and if defeated claim fraud. He [Khrushchev] has suffered, one defeat after another the past week and he shows it by knocking on the desk with his fist -- Republican Vice Presidential candidate.
docs.abstract: excerpts from world opinion on session and Khrushchev

headline.main: Opinion of the Week: At Home and Abroad

docs.snippet: NEXT Friday a little lady in Washington' will be celebrating her ninety-third birthday, and it would not be surprising if she were to end the day by attending a chamber-music concert at the Library of Congress.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEXT Friday a little lady in Washington' will be celebrating her ninety-third birthday, and it would not be surprising if she were to end the day by attending a chamber-music concert at the Library of Congress.

headline.main: THE WORLD OF MUSIC: BIRTHDAYS; Whittall Foundation And Its Benefactor Have Anniversaries

docs.snippet: Week Ended Sept. 30, 1960 Movements in the foreign exchange market were erratic during the past week. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar turned soft around mid-week then steadied on fairly large turnover.

docs.snippet: The Secretary General of the Organization of American, States warned yesterday that the nations of the Western Hemisphere had to be prepared to fight for the liberty of the area.
